content: Hi, I am Federico Carrone. I work with Iñaki Garay at our company Lambda. With Aki we talked with @nikomatsakis to see how we can start helping with documentation. I have already planned to have at least two devs (we went to the rust latam with a few of them) of my company 4 hours per week each to help improve the documentation of rustc.
I am reading the rustc guide and the rustc code. I have yet a lot to learn but we have energy and time to contribute back as much as possible

thanks @nikomatsakis . Where should we discuss how start collaborating with documentation? I am in the middle of reading the rustc guide. It would be great to know what is a priority. It might be a good idea to do what @centril mentioned at @Iñaki Garay introduction topic (don't know yet how to point to a particular topic of a stream): documenting the hell out of a module or to have call where you or anybody explain something, we take notes and we create a PR for the rustc guide.
